explanation:
Needed symbols and why:

- struct Md5Ctx
  - The conditionals in the function depend on ctx fields (ctx->count, ctx->buffer, ctx->H). To decide if any controlling expression can be invariant you must know the exact types and ranges of these fields (e.g. type and width of count, whether any field is volatile, layout of buffer) so you can determine whether bytes_have and related values are compile-time constants or vary at runtime.

- MD5_BLOCK_SIZE
  - Appears in the controlling expression (MD5_BLOCK_SIZE - bytes_have < MD5_SIZE_OF_LEN_ADD) and in the computation of bytes_have ((ctx->count & (MD5_BLOCK_SIZE - 1))). Its value (and whether it is a macro constant) is required to decide whether the comparison can ever be invariant for all possible bytes_have values.

- MD5_SIZE_OF_LEN_ADD
  - Used in the same conditional as MD5_BLOCK_SIZE. Its value relative to MD5_BLOCK_SIZE determines whether the if-condition can be always true or false regardless of runtime bytes_have.

- _MHD_UINT32_ALIGN
  - Used in the alignment test ((uintptr_t) digest) % _MHD_UINT32_ALIGN inside an if expression. If this constant equals 1 (or another value that makes the modulus result invariant) the controlling expression could be invariant. You must know its value to decide whether that if becomes an invariant test.

- MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE
  - A preprocessor option that changes which if/else blocks are compiled. Whether this macro is defined alters whether the controlling expression contains the runtime alignment test or reduces to a constant; you must know its defined/undefined status for correct analysis.

- _MHD_PUT_32BIT_LE_UNALIGNED
  - Another preprocessor macro that changes which branch is compiled (the branch containing unconditional if (1) vs the branch that contains the runtime test). Its defined/undefined status affects whether any compiled if has an invariant controlling expression.

(Other macros/helpers used only for data movement or for non-controlling expressions—e.g. _MHD_PUT_64BIT_LE_SAFE, md5_transform, _MHD_PUT_32BIT_LE—are not required to decide whether the function contains invariant controlling expressions.)
